column4: Shall measure motor speed (Kv).
column5:
Optical or hall effect or both. Hall effect is affected by (non)ferrous motor rotor (bell) materials. Note: Technically, Kv is the output voltage when the shaft is rotated.

Kv is defined as the velocity constant in rpm/V. Ke is the back emf constant. In SI units is V/(rad/s) or in hobby units V/rpm. It is is an inverse measure of Kv
